document.title: The Found Play: Learning and Teaching the Value of Interpretive Reading and Writing

author.institution: Poetry Editor of The New Quarterly

document.abstract: The "found" play is designed to make explicit the interpretive strategies that students use in everyday life, in a literary work, and in critical reading and writing.
document.publication-title: The Journal of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Randi Patterson is completing her dissertation in rhetorical theory and Romanticism. She also is a poetry editor ofThe New Quarterly, a Canadian literary magazine. Kim Jernigan teaches in the Writing Clinic at the University of Waterloo and is a fiction editor ofThe New Quarterly. They thank students Emily Arrowsmith, Heath Hutchings, Scott Nicholson, and Ang Vachon for permitting them to use their work and the Fall l994 102A-Renison students for their reaction to it.
